sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SKIDS, or Skeeds, in ſea-language, are long compaſſing pieces of timber, notched below ſo as to fit cloſely upon the wales, extending from the main-wale to the top of the side, and retained in this poſition by bolts or ſpike-nails. They are intended for preſerving the planks of the side, when any heavy body is hoiſted or lowered.
